basics.name: Brian Davis
basics.label: Full Stack .NET C# Developer | Seeking Senior Software Engineer Opportunities | Microsoft Stack Enthusiast
basics.summary:
With a solid background in cloud architecture and expertise in Azure DevOps, my tenure at GEICO has been marked by advancing microservices development and enhancing system reliability through innovative monitoring solutions. The transformation of monolithic systems into efficient, scalable microservices stands as a testament to our team's collaborative efforts in modernizing enterprise applications. 

At JobNimbus, my role extended beyond engineering; by mentoring over ten engineers, we fostered a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous improvement. The successful migration to a new major CouchBase version and significant enhancements to the company's PDF service are highlights of our team's dedication to technological excellence and agile best practices. These experiences reflect my passion for leading-edge cloud solutions and a persistent drive towards operational excellence in software development. Our use of DataDog for monitoring and alerts showcases our commitment to proactive system management and seamless user experiences.

work.name: GEICO
work.summary:
Technical lead for Managed File Transfer (MFT) Team responsible in
creating an in-house solution to replace 3rd party software's
● Onboarded and mentored 5+ engineers

● Provided customer support
● Troubleshooting of network and servers
● RSA and Open PGP Encryption
● File Transfer Methods: SFTP,Azure Blob, Azure File Share, SMB 3.0

work.name: Nubitz
work.summary:
JobNimbus (contract)

• Broke down and migrated over an monolithic .Net 4.5 Web Forms with WCF web application into three different parts UI, API, and Background Service workers that used RabbitMQ. 

• Created  a new self contained organizational structure for features within the monolithic App class library that both the API and Worker projects shared, using the screaming architecture design pattern in preparation for eventually moving features into their own microservices at a later time in the future. 

iGrad (contract)

• Helped with creating a .Net core API for their educational system backend. 

• Went over the pros and cons of various approaches in their system design and the best path to reach their end goals.

work.name: Persuasive Media
work.summary:
•Migrated website  from a 3rd party hosting provider to Azure. 

•Created a brand new Azure DevOps pipeline to have Continuous Integration (CI) with Continuous Deployments (CD) to Azure web sites.

•Helped train team members on how to use the new pipeline and Azure platform and how to work with Azure DevOps in general.

•As a senior Asp.net developer made sure that the web app overall is working correctly and helped in refactoring the web application to run better and updated areas that were outdated.

•Help in removing duplicate calls to the database, and rewriting some of the logic so that the web pages load faster. Also migrated the existing code from the controllers to a new Service layer to reduce the amount of code in the controllers and to help improve the web application performance.

•Created a background Sync service that uses Azure Webjobs to sync content between two different websites that need to share data that they have in common, runs on a nightly basis.

work.name: National Security Agency
work.summary:
Global system monitoring operator
24-Hours Operations Center, NSA, July 9, 2004 - Oct 20, 2004

    * Provided troubleshooting support for several intelligence partners on various systems.
    * Performed multiple duties using UNIX and NT base computer systems in-house and via remote access to deployed systems.
    * Assisted in training multiple operators in various tasks to perform mission duties.
    * Performed duties associated with Satellite Communications equipment.

references.name: Niky Mangkudihardjo
references.reference: Brian is a colleague and mentor who loves to share knowledge with team members. His expertise and knowledge in C# and asp.net are unquestionable. Brian often takes the time to share knowledge and contribute in his field of expertise with team members.

references.name: Juan Lizarazo
references.reference:
I had the pleasure of working with Brian at Jobnimbus for over two years! He was of great help in discovering and fixing root causes, improving our logging and alerts, and finding flaws in the solutions we were implementing.

I lost count of how often Brian helped me discover issues before customers brought them up. He also helped to bring to market countless features in his time at Jobnimbus!

Brian will be a great addition to your engineering department.

references.name: Jarom Plewe
references.reference: Brian is one of the most dependable and knowledgeable people I’ve worked with. He is an incredible team player and will drop anything to help a team member in need.  Brian is they type of person you can throw on any task and if he doesn’t know how to do it, he will figure it out on his own. I hope to have the opportunity to work with him again soon.

references.name: Ryan Quackenbush
references.reference: Brian is an excellent developer. He is the first to jump on a problem and isn’t afraid to dive deep to find a solution. On top of that he’s easy to work with and takes feedback extremely well. A great person to add to your team!

references.name: Nate Graham
references.reference: I worked with Brian at JobNimbus, and he has an uncanny ability to dive deep into diagnosing and fixing issues. Brian was instrumental in getting our team's server monitoring and alerts dialed in so we could actually sleep at night. Brian is always the first to jump in and help where ever he can. I've never seen him stressed out or frustrated; he is consistent, friendly, helpful, and kind to everyone he works with.

references.name: Tai Olson
references.reference: Brian is someone I truly hope to get to work with again in the future. The determination to fully map out a problem before tackling it, teaching team members about all the intricacies of various tools in the tech stack, or simply by being the first to jump in and help out when there is a need. Brian embodies all of these things, and then some!

references.name: Kristopher Powell
references.reference:
Working with Brian has been fantastic -- he's always so willing to step up and help out wherever he's needed. Couple that with his expertise and natural friendliness and you've got something special!

I've worked on and off with him over the course of the last year (and much more closely over the last few months), and I can say that I don't know anybody who is as good as Brian when it comes to digging deep and troubleshooting data, problems, and coming up with solutions.

Plus, not only does he excel at investigating, he also loves to share his knowledge with everybody around him and help them level up! I have personally learned a great deal during my time working with him.

Every team needs a Brian.

references.name: Travis Chapman
references.reference: Brian cares deeply. He is deeply concerned with building and maintaining a robust system to provide value to customers.

references.name: Rishi Kapadia
references.reference: Brian is a really good developer, understands the existing system well, and suggests good changes. His debugging skill is also really good and never hesitate to debug and troubleshoot the complex issue. I enjoy working with him. He is very dedicated and hard-working.

references.name: Steve Shepherd
references.reference:
I have worked with Brian for almost two years at JobNimbus. He is a phenomenal engineer and one of the best debuggers and tooling experts in the business. Brian also has a lot of amazing ideas for improving scaling of architecture and infrastructure.

At JobNimbus, he was our Datadog Guru. He is a master at finding the right data and pinpointing the source of performance issues and API problems. Brian provided us meaningful monitors and alerts, as well as information that both helped us resolve incidents faster and enabled us to react to them more quickly. His thorough analysis and sharp intuition were key to resolving many issues in our CI/CD and infrastructure.

Some of Brian's other top skills include .NET, Couchbase, AWS, and other tools like RabbitMQ.

What I love most about Brian is how team-committed and caring he is. He is a good mentor and often comes to you out of the blue with new solutions that apply to the problems you've talked with him about. He will seek out knowledge and thoughtfully and eagerly share it. He helped me learn Datadog and taught me a lot about our architecture and system. I'm better at my job because of him.

You could not have a better data guy than Brian on your team, and I heartily recommend him if you are looking for a talented software engineer and all-around great person!
